00001 #!/usr/bin/env python
00002 
00003 import logging
00004 import cgi
00005 from cStringIO import StringIO
00006 from string import capwords, strip, split, join
00007 
00008 # CGI trackback and logging
00009 import cgitb; cgitb.enable()
00010 
00011 # My code!
00012 import dictToDot
00013 import dotProcessor
00014 import osSpec
00015 
00016 ##  Parse INDS into graphviz DOT language graph via CGI
00017 # Now broken into two phases: Phase one, via indsInterface, fetches all the 
00018 # information from INDS via HTTP and builds a dot-language graph from it. 
00019 # Phase two, via dotProcessor, saves the graph to a temporary file and runs the
00020 # dot binary to generate SVG.
00021 #
00022 # @file xRender.py
00023 # @author Paul Hubbard pfhubbar@ucsd.edu
00024 # @date 1/7/09
00025 # @todo Add URLs to nodes for multi-system graphs
00026 # @todo Consider moving to webdot instead of binary dot
00027 # @note See also the defaults.cfg configuration file
00028 
00029 ## xRender handles the CGI interface, HTML and invoking the other classes.
00030 class xRender(object):
00031     
00032     ## Required HTML header
00033     header = 'Content-Type: text/html\n\n'
00034     
00035     ## Main output HTML; Note that we simply return a link to the static SVG file.
00036     mainhtml = '''<HTML><HEAD><TITLE>
00037 xRender INDS visualizer</TITLE></HEAD>
00038 <BODY>
00039 <iframe src="/inds-svg/%s" width="%s" height="%s" 
00040 frameborder="0" marginwidth="0" marginheight="0">
00041 <object type="image/svg+xml" data="/inds-svg/%s" width="%s" height="%s"
00042 name="output" alt="SVG drawing of INDS XML system">
00043 <embed src="/inds-svg/%s" type="image/svg+xml"
00044     palette="foreground">
00045 </embed>
00046 </object>
00047 </iframe>
00048 </BODY></HTML>  
00049     '''
00050     ## HTML to display if unable to poll INDS execution manager
00051     exManErrHtml =  '''<HTML><HEAD><TITLE>
00052     Error running INDS Execution Manager query</TITLE></HEAD>
00053     <BODY>
00054     An error occurred while querying the INDS execution manager.<p>
00055     Error message:
00056     <pre>
00057     %s
00058     </pre>
00059     %s
00060     </BODY></HTML>  
00061     ''' 
00062     ## HTML to display if dot fails to run correctly
00063     dotErrHtml = '''<HTML><HEAD><TITLE>
00064     xRender INDS visualizer</TITLE></HEAD>
00065     <BODY>
00066 An error occurred while running 'dot' to convert the graph into an SVG graphic. Error code was %d.
00067 %s
00068 </BODY></HTML>  
00069 '''     
00070     ## HTML to display if dot throws an exception
00071     dotExceptHtml = '''<HTML><HEAD>
00072     <TITLE>xRender INDS visualizer</TITLE></HEAD>
00073     <BODY>
00074 An exception occurred while trying to run the 'dot' program.
00075 <p>Error message:
00076 <pre>
00077 %s
00078 </pre>
00079 %s
00080 </BODY></HTML>  
00081 '''     
00082     ## Dump of configuration variables for debugging
00083     configHtml = '''
00084 <h3>Configuration</h3>
00085 <pre>
00086  INDS hostname: %s
00087  INDS viewer hostname: %s
00088  dot command: %s
00089  dot parameters: %s
00090  Last checksum: %s
00091 </pre>
00092 '''
00093     ## HTML to display if errors in configuration file or object creation
00094     initErrHtml = '''
00095     <HTML><HEAD>
00096     <TITLE>xRender INDS visualizer</TITLE></HEAD>
00097     <BODY>
00098 An error occurred in initialization.
00099 <p>Error message:
00100 <pre>
00101 %s
00102 </pre>
00103 %s
00104 </BODY></HTML>  
00105 ''' 
00106 
00107     ## This gets called if no change to XML, or new graph generated OK.
00108     def doNormalOutput(self):
00109         # Build output HTML. We have to do this in two steps because
00110         # python gets confused by 100% in a format string, even escaped.
00111         outName = 'inds.svg'
00112         sizeStr = '100%'
00113         intHtml = xRender.mainhtml % (outName, \
00114         sizeStr, sizeStr, outName, sizeStr, sizeStr, outName)
00115 
00116         print xRender.header + intHtml
00117         
00118     ## CGI main routine.
00119     def doResults(self):
00120 
00121         # Parse configuration, instantiate dotMaker object
00122         try:
00123             # Load up config file
00124             mc = osSpec.osSpec()
00125             
00126             # Read the system config and create HTML snippet for same
00127             cfgHtml = self.configHtml % \
00128             (mc.indsHostname, mc.viewHostname, mc.dotCmd, mc.dotParams, mc.hexDigest)
00129             
00130             # Instantiate the dict-to-dot. 
00131             grapher = dictToDot.dotMaker()  
00132             
00133         except BaseException, e:
00134             intHtml = xRender.header + xRender.initErrHtml % (cgi.escape(str(e)), cfgHtml)
00135             
00136         # Run the INDS->dot 
00137         try:
00138             grapher.main()
00139             
00140             # Same configuration as last run, as evinced by digest of command list?
00141             if grapher.isStale == True:
00142                 logging.info('Returning previous SVG, no change in command list.')
00143                 self.doNormalOutput()
00144                 return
00145                 
00146         except BaseException, e:
00147             intHtml = xRender.header + xRender.exManErrHtml % (cgi.escape(str(e)), cfgHtml)
00148             print intHtml
00149             return
00150 
00151         # Save results to a temporary file and then run dot to generate the SVG
00152         try:
00153             logging.debug('Saving dot to tempfile')
00154             # Save results to a temporary file
00155             inFile = dotProcessor.saveDot(grapher.outputDot)
00156 
00157             logging.debug('dot saved to ' + inFile)
00158             
00159             basename = 'inds'
00160             # Run it
00161             logging.debug("Running DOT to generate SVG")
00162             rc = dotProcessor.runDotDualFN(inFile, basename, 'svg')
00163         except BaseException, e:
00164             print xRender.header + xRender.dotExceptHtml % (cgi.escape(str(e)), cfgHtml)
00165             return
00166         
00167         if(rc == 0):
00168             self.doNormalOutput()
00169         else:
00170             print xRender.header + xRender.dotErrHtml % (rc, cfgHtml)
00171             
00172 # End of class xRender
00173         
00174 ## Test harness/CGI entrypoint
00175 if __name__ == '__main__':
00176     logging.basicConfig(level=logging.DEBUG, \
00177                         format='%(asctime)s %(levelname)s %(message)s')
00178     page = xRender()
00179     page.doResults()
